// EXPLANATION: Custom ESLint configuration for React Hooks
// PURPOSE: Provides granular control over exhaustive-deps warnings
// USAGE: Extend this in .eslintrc.json to customize hook rules

1. Missing Dependencies.problem: React Hook has a missing dependency
solutions: Add the dependency to the array
Use useCallback/useMemo to stabilize the dependency
Use useStableCallback if you need latest values without re-creating

2. Unnecessary Dependencies.problem: React Hook has an unnecessary dependency
solutions: Verify the value actually causes re-renders
Check if it's a stable reference (useCallback, imported function)

3. Complex Expressions.problem: React Hook has a complex expression in dependency array
solutions: Extract the expression to a variable with useMemo
Use a stable reference with useCallback
Simplify the dependency to a primitive value

4. Ref Cleanup Issues.problem: Ref value will likely have changed by cleanup time
solutions: Copy ref.current to a variable inside the effect
Use the copied variable in the cleanup function
Example: const element = ref.current; return () => cleanup(element)

High: Missing callback dependencies causing unnecessary re-renders
Complex expressions recalculating on every render
Medium: Missing effect dependencies causing stale closures
Low: Unnecessary deps on stable values (just noise)
